intro: Taraxacum ajanense, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Central America and parts of South America, including Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of pale green, hairy leaves and a yellow composite flower head that develops into a spherical seed head. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and disturbed soils, and is often found in open, sunny areas. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
